description: UMD 4.8.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It add updates for CentOS7 and SL6.&nbsp;
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6:&nbsp;</div><div><ul><li>APEL-SSM 2.3.0 - several new features, among which Ubuntu support and Ipv6 support, see the <a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/releases">release notes</a><br></li><li>XRootD 4.8.4 - major bug fixes and improvements, see the <a href="http://xrootd.org/2018/07/06/announcement_4_8_4.html">release notes</a><br></li><li>CernVM-FS 2.5.1 - bugfixes and improvements for clients, stratum 0 and stratum 1 servers; support for Ubuntu Bionic. See <a href="https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.5/cpt-releasenotes.html">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.28-3.1 - see <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>DPM 1.10.4 - several improvements and bug fixes, see <a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dpm-1104-epel-testing">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>Dynafed 1.3.2 - improvements and bug fixes in the <a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dynafed-132-released-epel">change log</a>&nbsp;</li><li>BDII 5.2.25 - several <a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/bdii/releases">fixes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>glite-info-update-endpoint 3.0.1 - updated in particular to drop OSG support, see <a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/glite-info-update-endpoints/releases">release notes</a></li><li>GRAM5 14.1.0, GridFTP 13.8.1 - <a href="https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2018-8aebaba2a9">bug fixes</a></li></ul></div>
installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.8.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk</a>&nbsp;to make a report.
knownIssues: Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.8.0 for known issues.
changeLog: <div>This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6:&nbsp;</div><div><ul><li>APEL-SSM 2.3.0 - several new features, among which Ubuntu support and Ipv6 support, see the&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/releases">release notes</a><br></li><li>XRootD 4.8.4 - major bug fixes and improvements, see the&nbsp;<a href="http://xrootd.org/2018/07/06/announcement_4_8_4.html">release notes</a><br></li><li>CernVM-FS 2.5.1 - bugfixes and improvements for clients, stratum 0 and stratum 1 servers; support for Ubuntu Bionic. See&nbsp;<a href="https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.5/cpt-releasenotes.html">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.28-3.1 - see&nbsp;<a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>DPM 1.10.4 - several improvements and bug fixes, see&nbsp;<a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dpm-1104-epel-testing">release notes</a>&nbsp;<br></li><li>Dynafed 1.3.2 - improvements and bug fixes in the&nbsp;<a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dynafed-132-released-epel">change log</a>&nbsp;</li><li>BDII 5.2.25 - several&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/bdii/releases">fixes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>glite-info-update-endpoint 3.0.1 - updated in particular to drop OSG support, see&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/glite-info-update-endpoints/releases">release notes</a></li><li>GRAM5 14.1.0, GridFTP 13.8.1 -&nbsp;<a href="https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2018-8aebaba2a9">bug fixes</a></li></ul></div>

products.name: apel.apel-ssm
products.description: Secure Stomp Messenger (SSM) is designed to simply send messages using the STOMP protocol. Messages are signed and may be encrypted during transit. Persistent queues should be used to guarantee delivery.

products.name: bdii.bdii
products.description: The Berkeley Database Information Index consists of a standard LDAP database which is updated by an external process. The update process obtains LDIF from a number of sources and merges them. It then compares this to the contents of the database and creates an LDIF file of the differences. This is then used to update the database.
products.changeLog: BDII package is a fix to the init script that was failing on stale PID  and glite-info-update-endpoint package is the drop of OSG support

products.name: cern.dynafed
products.description: The Dynamic Federations system allows to expose via HTTP and WebDAV a very fast dynamic name space, built on the fly by merging and caching (in memory) metadata items taken from a number of (remote) endpoints.

products.name: cernfrontier.squid
products.description: The Frontier distributed database caching system uses a RESTful http-based protocol to distribute data queries. The LHC experiments ATLAS and CMS use it to access conditions data describing their complicated detectors, and cache the results at all the worldwide sites that process their particle collision data. This twiki site contains documentation for the software of the Frontier system that is not experiment-specific.

products.name: cernvm.cvmfs
products.description: CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way. Files and file metadata are aggressively cached and downloaded on demand. Thereby the CernVM-FS decouples the life cycle management of the application software releases from the operating system. CernVM-FS is included in CernVM, however it can also be used outside CernVM.

products.name: dpm.dmlite
products.description: DMLite is a plugin-based C++ framework that gives functionality for namespace management, pool management and i/o access.This is at the heart of the DPM, LFC and Dynamic Federations projects, together with the other DPM backends and frontends.

products.name: dpm.dpm
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: globus.gram5
products.description: The Grid Resource Allocation and Management (GRAM5) interface as a basic mechanism for initiation, monitoring, management, scheduling, and/or coordination of remote computations.

products.name: globus.gridftp
products.description: GridFTP provides high-performance and reliable data transport.

products.name: infoprovider.glite-info-update-endpoints
products.description: GLUE2 BDII info provider for cloud services
